prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. He wasn't serious when he gave this to me... was he?* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 1
Name: Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.* (when playing as Wright) Received from Wright. Something about reading people's hearts... What utter nonsense.* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Evidence 2
Name: Oh! Cult! New Year's Issue
Description: An occult magazine featuring Hazakura Temple. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Hazakura Temple Map
Description: Shows Hazakura Temple and the surrounding area. Click here for details.
Evidence 4
Name: Hanging Scroll
Description: Shows Misty Fey, Master of the Kurain Technique. Click here for details. Misty Fey's image is obscured by gravy. Godot described her as 'clad in her stunning Japanese garb surrounded by the hue and aroma of Western tastes'.
Evidence 5
Name: Photo of Elise
Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Hood
Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.
Evidence 7
Name: Weather Data
Description: A regional weather report for the night of the crime.
Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

Snow: 7 to approx. 10:50 PM
Lightning: 10 to approx. 11 PM

Lightning struck Dusky Bridge at 10:45.
Around 30 minutes passed between
the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13
Name: Crime Photo
Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I went to the Inner Temple that night and I saw it all happen in the garden.
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: I saw Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: While Mystic Maya was still stumbling, Mystic Elise moved in to deliver a fatal strike!
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Maya tried desperately to defend herself and stole the weapon...!
Person: Iris
Testimony 5
Testimony: It was only in self-defense! You can't blame her for it!
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: The testimony by Iris claims that "Mystic Elise strike Mystic Maya with her staff" and later that "She threw her staff away and pulled a dagger from inside her robe!" However, per Evidence 9, the Victim's Staff, it is noted that the staff had a hidden sword and was used in the murder. Therefore, there is a contradiction because Elise supposedly used the staff, discarded it, and then pulled a dagger, whereas the staff itself had a hidden weapon that was used to murder the victim.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Mystic Maya stumbled briefly after being hit over the head with the staff...
Person: Iris
Testimony 1
Testimony: But then she dodged Mystic Elise's next attack and stole her weapon!
Person: Iris
Testimony 2
Testimony: Suddenly Mystic Elise was the one on the defensive, with her back to the stone lantern.
Person: Iris
Testimony 3
Testimony: That's when Mystic Maya stabbed Mystic Elise!
Person: Iris
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mystic Elise managed to fling the knife away, but then... Then... she collapsed.
Person: Iris

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
First, let's analyze Iris's testimonies regarding the sequence of events involving Mystic Maya and Mystic Elise. According to Testimony 3, Iris claims that Mystic Maya stabbed Mystic Elise.

Now, let's cross-reference this statement with the relevant pieces of evidence. According to Evidence 9, the actual weapon used to murder the victim was the Victim's Staff, which has a sword hidden inside and is consistent with the cause of death being a stab in the back. This contradicts the series of events suggested by the testimonies, particularly since Iris said Mystic Maya stabbed Elise, implying she used the Shichishito (Evidence 10). However, the Shichishito, listed in Evidence 10, is stated not to be the actual murder weapon.

Therefore, there is a contradiction between Iris's testimony (that Mystic Maya stabbed Mystic Elise) and the fact that the staff was the actual weapon used, not the Shichishito, which was only believed to be the murder weapon due to the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: The evidence "Tracks Photo" (Evidence 14) contradicts Iris's testimony where she claims to have dragged the body across Dusky Bridge (Testimony 3). If Iris had dragged the body across the bridge after the murder, there should have been tracks visible in the snow. However, the "Tracks Photo" shows tracks leading from the Main Gate to Dusky Bridge but not from Dusky Bridge back across it, which suggests the body was not dragged in the manner she described.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: The evidence that contradicts Maya's testimonies is the Stone Lantern (Evidence 20). Maya's testimonies describe her being attacked in the garden and noticing a man behind her attacker "by the light of the stone lantern" (Testimony 4). However, the Stone Lantern (Evidence 20) specifically states that it "was not lit the night of the crime." Therefore, Maya could not have seen anything by the light of the stone lantern, leading to a contradiction between her testimony and this piece of evidence.

Character 1

Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago. She was the attorney when Dahlia Hawthorne was sentenced to death. 
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Bikini
Description: A hearty, motherly nun at Hazakura Temple, a channeling dojo deep in the mountains.
Character 5
Name: Elise Deauxnim
Description: Kind-eyed author and illustrator of picture books. Pearls is huge fan of hers.
Character 6
Name: Iris
Description: A nun at Hazakura Temple. She reminds me so much of "her"...
Character 7
Name: Laurice Deauxnim* (when playing as Wright) → Larry Butz* (when playing as Edgeworth)
Description: Better known as Larry Butz. Current in training as Elise Deauxnim's pupil.
Character 8
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My friend since grade school. Fell from Dusky Bridge and is currently hospitalized.
Character 9
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 10
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: My mentor, Manfred von Karma's, daughter. Born/raised in Germany. Prosecutor at 13.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: An old friend. Said to be #1 at the D.A.'s office. Studies foreign judicial systems now.
Character 12
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Older sister of Misty Fey and mother of Pearl and Iris. Is in solitary confinement.
Character 13
Name: ?????? → Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Morgan Fey's daughter and Iris's twin sister. Her father deals in jewelry apparently.

Description: Taken by her only pupil, Laurice Deauxnim. Click here for details.

Description: A magical hood said to offer protection from evil spirits. Received before the lights out bell the night of the crime. Protects from evil spirits.

Eagle Mountain Weather Data for Feb. 07
Snow, with occasional lightning strikes.

the fire starting and going out.
Evidence 8
Name: Note to Iris
Description: Found in the Main Hall. Maybe she dropped it? Click here for details.
Evidence 9
Name: Victim's Staff
Description: Carried by Elise Deauxnim when she was alive. Has her fingerprints on it. Has a sword hidden inside. No one knows this except Detective Gumshoe and I. Has a sword hidden inside. The actual weapon used to murder the victim.
Evidence 10
Name: Shichishito
Description: The apparent murder weapon. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it. Had the victim's blood and the suspect's fingerprints on it, but is not the murder weapon.
Evidence 11
Name: Elise's Autopsy Report
Description: Time: 10 - 11 PM. Cause: loss of blood from stab in back. Body fell 10 ft. after death.
Evidence 12
Name: Iris's Testimony
Description: Rang lights out bell at 10 PM and was then in her room until the murder was discovered.
Evidence 13

Description: The courtyard where Elise Deauxnim was murdered. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: Tracks Photo
Description: Taken that night. From Main Gate to Dusky Bridge. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Larry's Sketch
Description: Horrible sketch of what he saw the night of the crime. A bridge is on fire. There are two draw strings slanted above the bridge. A sihouette is seen gliding over the bridge. 
Evidence 16
Name: Crystal Sphere
Description: Found half-covered in snow near Dusky Bridge the night of the crime. Has blood on it. Found on outcropping near Dusky Bridge. Has blood on it. Came from the victim's staff.
Evidence 17
Name: Kurain Master's Talisman
Description: Worn by Elise Deauxnim. Found in the garden of the Inner Temple.
Evidence 18
Name: Burnt Letter
Description: Found by Gumshoe in the Inner Temple incinerator. Click here for details. Orders from Morgan Fey. Opened once before. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Dagger
Description: Found behind a tree in the Inner Temple garden. The blood is being analyzed now. Found stuck in a pine tree in Inner Temple Garden. The blood doesn't match the victim's.
Evidence 20
Name: Stone Lantern
Description: A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime.
Evidence 21
Name: Dusky Bridge Photo
Description: Taken the morning after the crime. Click here for details.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: ...When I came to, I was just lying there on the Training Hall floor.
Person: Maya
Testimony 1
Testimony: By the time I got back to the garden, the place had totally changed...
Person: Maya
Testimony 2
Testimony: I think it was for my sake that the killer cleaned up the evidence of what had happened.
Person: Maya
Testimony 3
Testimony: The torches were lit... And the body was gone.
Person: Maya
Testimony 4
Testimony: And all of the snow around the stone lantern had been carefully cleaned up, too.
Person: Maya
Testimony 5
Testimony: Since the person did all that work alone, I just assumed it was a man...
Person: Maya

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
To identify a contradiction, we need to find where a testimony does not align with the given evidence. Let's examine Maya's testimony and compare it with the evidence:

Testimony 3 says: "The torches were lit... And the body was gone."

Referring to Evidence 20:
- Evidence 20 is the Stone Lantern, which states, "A lantern from the Inner Temple garden. Was not lit the night of the crime."

The contradiction here is that Maya claims the torches were lit, but the Stone Lantern, which is part of the lighting in the temple garden, was not lit according to the evidence.

Thus, the contradiction is between Evidence 20 and Testimony 3.

cot:
One testimony says Mr. Godot arrived at the Inner Temple for the first time, implying he was not there previously. However, considering the nature of evidence and the context, there aren't specific evidence numbers listed indicating Godot being somewhere else directly on that night. Instead, the surrounding evidence indirectly indicates that events had transpired already by the time Godot arrived the following day.

The contradiction lies with the specifics of the testimony regarding Godot's first arrival and an implication that he would have needed to be present to prevent certain outcomes, such as Maya being found by Godot afterward. This suggests perhaps other people had not already been there, as the testimony may suggest otherwise about the timing.

To contradict Testimony 3 directly, it could relate back to the evidence indicating already transpired events reliant on others being present prior, such as other people being found beside Godot.

Given these dynamics, and aligning with various specifics, no singular evidence number outright shows Godot was in an area he shouldn't have been already before arriving, but contextually Evidence 7 (Weather Data) alongside other evidence seem to suggest technical implications about bridging existences needed prior, potentially contradicting the supposed nature of the testimony regarding "cheered her right up" as well in a way where:
